name: Andorra, The Little Big Country Online Quiz | Geography | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is the capital of Andorra?
questions.explanation:
Andorra-La-Vella.

	Set in the centre of the country, this small but beautiful capital city is very near to world class ski resorts.

questions.text: What is the official language of Andorra?
questions.explanation:
Catalan.

	Although you are probably as likely to hear French, Castilian or even Portuguese being spoken.

A Principality.

	A parliamentary democracy, Andorra remains a Co-Principality.

1278.

	Andorra was declared a free state by Charlemagne in the 9th century. In 1278 it became an independent Principality under the control of France and Spain. In 1993 Andorra's citizens voted to have a new constitution and Andorra was admitted into the United Nations.

questions.text: Who are the two Princes of Andorra?
questions.correct: The President of France and the Bishop of Urgel
options: The Queen of England and the President of the European Union
The Pope and the King of Spain
The Chancellor of Germany and the President of Portugal
questions.explanation:
The President of France and the Bishop of Urgel.

	Andorra pays a regular tribute to the incumbents of each office.

questions.text: The Andorran government's biggest spending headache is the military. True or false?
questions.explanation:
False.

	Andorra has no military. The defence of the country is the responsibility of Spain and France.

questions.text: What is the name of the main airport of Andorra?
questions.explanation:
Andorra has no airports.

	The tiny country has no airports and no rail system, but possesses an excellent road system.

questions.text: Deforestation is an issue in Andorra.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Forests of pine and birch trees are found high in the Pyrenees, concern over the maintenance of these forests is a burning issue for the government. Soil erosion from over grazing is also causing concern.

questions.text: What is the name of the peace treaty signed by France and Spain, that resulted in Andorra's independence and which is still in force?
questions.explanation:
The Pareage.

	The constant fighting between France and Spain prompted the King of Aragon to force the treaty upon them. The treaty called for Andorra to pay a yearly tribute, called the Pestia to France and Spain alternately. This tribute is still payed.

questions.text: Until 2014, there was no personal income tax payable by Andorran residents.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Viewed as a tax haven, Andorra attracts a lot of tourists, which account for most of the country's income. Personal income tax wasn't payable, but there was a levy for social security benefits which was taken from a person's wage. In 2014, Andorra, at the request of other European nations, agreed to introduce income tax as a measure to lessen tax evasion in Europe.
